title: Quiz 5: Fertilisation & Development
description: Assessment of the process of conception, implantation, and foetal growth milestones.

questions.question: How many chromosomes does a Zygote contain?
questions.explanation: A sperm (23) and ovum (23) combine to form a Zygote with 46 chromosomes (23 pairs).
questions.hint: It is the full human count.

questions.question: Trace the development of the fertilized ovum:
questions.hint: Starts as one cell, becomes a cluster, then a hollow ball, then attaches.

questions.question: Match the embryonic layer with the body systems it forms:
questions.hint: Ecto means outer, Meso means middle.

questions.question: Implantation of the blastocyst usually occurs on the ___BLANK___ day after fertilisation.
questions.explanation: Implantation begins around the 6th day after fertilization.

questions.question: At which week of gestation is the foetal heart typically first heard on auscultation (and mother feels quickening)?
questions.explanation: Between 16-20 weeks, quickening occurs and the heart can be heard.
questions.hint: This is roughly midway through pregnancy.

questions.question: What is the specific name given to the endometrium during pregnancy?
questions.explanation: The decidua is the thickened, vascular endometrium of pregnancy.

questions.question: Which of the following are functions of the Amniotic Fluid? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Amniotic fluid protects, allows movement, and equalizes pressure. It does not produce blood.
questions.hint: It is a protective liquid cushion.

questions.question: The sperm determines the sex of the baby.
questions.explanation: The ovum always carries X; the sperm carries X or Y. XY=Male, XX=Female.
